body_html: I recently fixed tf.range to accept between 1 and 3 arguments (like Python's range). This change will be part of the upcoming 0.6.0 release, but you're using the 0.5.0 release, and a version of cifar10 from git. Quick fix: use tf.range(0, FLAGS.batch_size) instead of tf.range(FLAGS.batch_size).
body_text: I recently fixed tf.range to accept between 1 and 3 arguments (like Python's range). Quick fix: use tf.range(0, FLAGS.batch_size) instead of tf.range(FLAGS.batch_size).
body: I recently fixed `tf.range` to accept between 1 and 3 arguments (like Python's `range`).  This change will be part of the upcoming 0.6.0 release, but you're using the 0.5.0 release, and a version of cifar10 from git.  Quick fix: use `tf.range(0, FLAGS.batch_size)` instead of `tf.range(FLAGS.batch_size)`.
